title: The 1975 stars Matt Healy and George Daniel caught smoking a cigarette under their table inside the BRIT Awards 2017 ceremony
text:
TV Magazine WHAT A DRAG The 1975 stars Matt Healy and George Daniel caught smoking a cigarette under their table inside the BRIT Awards 2017 ceremony 
Singer Matt, who is the son of Loose Women star Denise Welch, was caught on camera with his bandmate By REBECCA POCKLINGTON 23rd February 2017, 9:38 am THE 1975 stars Matt Healy and George Daniel were caught appearing to smoke a cigarette under their TABLE inside the BRIT Awards ceremony last night. 
Denise Welch’s son and his bandmate were caught on camera as they puffed and blew smoke between them, before quickly holding their hand up to block the view. 19 Matt Healy and George Daniel were crouched under the table together 
The clip was recorded by bass player Ross MacDonald, and shows George initially puffing, before passing what appears to be the cigarette to Matt. 
Revealing just how central the table was in the ceremony, the camera slowly pans round to reveal the whole O2 arena and the stage in front of them. 
Matt then quickly jumps up and starts clapping as the crowd breaks into applause. 
Ross added the video with the caption: “@brits LOL”. George and Matt shared the cigarette 
The Sun Online has contacted both stars’ reps for comment. 
The group took to the stage to perform their hit song The Sound after winning the British Group gong earlier in the evening. ITV The 1975 performed at The BRITs on Wednesday night, but viewers thought they had been hacked ITV 19 A minute and a half into the performance, pink screens with writing on criticising the band appeared 
But almost a minute and a half into the track, a pink screen with the words ‘Is this a joke?’ appeared, before quickly going back to the group’s performance. 
However seconds later, the pink screen was back with the words ‘Do people really still make music like this?’ before being followed by other posts including statements like, ‘There’s no danger in this music at all’ and ‘This band thinks it has a charismatic singer…’ 
The interruptions lead many viewers to suspect foul play and that someone had hacked into the broadcast to post the messages. ITV Lead singer Matt Healy put on a quirky performance Twitter But some viewers thought the band’s performance had been hacked Twitter Many were confused by the footage Twitter 19 Twitter users didn’t know what was going on 
Taking to Twitter, one viewer wrote alongside a screen grab of their TV: “Someone’s been hacked” with lots of crying with laughter emojis. 
Another added: “Has someone hacked the tv whilst the 1975 are playing or something??” 
A third also thought the band were on the receiving end of a cruel prank as they wrote: “Is this a part of #1975 act or has someone hacked the #BRITs”. ITV The words on screen looked like a cruel prank had been played RELATED STORIES NUMB SKULL Katy Perry makes a 'laughing stock' of herself with giant-skeleton dig at Theresa May and Donald Trump in BRITs performance 'WE'LL ALWAYS BE 1D' One Direction's Liam Payne makes surprise appearance at the BRIT Awards 2017 BRITS STAGE FAIL Hilarious moment Katy Perry's backing dancer falls off stage during BRITs performance WISH YOU WERE HERE BRITs hosts Dermot O'Leary and Emma Willis pay tribute to Michael Buble after he was forced to quit 'i loved him' Andrew Ridgeley joins Pepsi & Shirlie and Chris Martin to pay tribute to George Michael at The BRIT Awards 
However fans of the group were quick to scoff at such a suggestion and also took to the social networking site to mock those who fell for it. 
One wrote: “Are people seriously thinking they hacked the Brits during the 1975 performance? lmfao okay” while another added: “everyone thinks #BRITs2017 was hacked l l is it not common knowledge that nobody roasts The 1975 more than they roast themselves?” ITV The band had won British Group earlier in the evening Twitter The band’s fans quickly clarified what was going on Twitter The fans couldn’t believe people had thought it was a genuine hacking incident Twitter 19 One cleverly used a pink screen grab to emphasise her point 
A third took a grab of one of the pink screens that said ‘…they are mistaken’ and used it to perfection as they wrote above it: “People think the 1975’s brit awards performance got hacked, but alas…” 
Another fan of the group cleared the matter up once and for all by writing: “The 1975 just trolled the British public with showing quotes from critics during their performance just after winning a BRIT- amazing” with a series of clapping hands emojis. Twitter Their fans loved they had trolled the public after winning an award ITV 19 The 1975 have released two albums so far 
The band were stunned to beat the likes of Bastille, Biffy Clyro and Radiohead to claim the best British Group award, with Matt saying it meant a lot considering he had been in the band since he was 13. 
While the guys were overwhelmed in the arena, Matt’s proud mum Denise was in bits at home. Twitter Matt’s proud mum Denise Welch shared a throwback snap after their win Twitter The actress was in tears as her son triumphed Twitter 19 She also joked her son had stole her dance moves 
She wrote on Twitter after their win: “Shaking and crying with pride!!!!” before posting a sweet throwback snap to when Matt was a little boy, captioning it, she wrote: “Thank you for your gorgeous love and support for my family xxx”. 
After watching the band’s performance, she added: “Matty stole all my dance moves so I accept your thanks!! xx”.
